By  THE ASSOCIATED PRESSFebruary  

CHICAGO AP  Senators Barack Obama and John McCain lead by better than 2to1 among likely Illinois presidential primary voters according to a poll released Saturday PERIOD

But  percent of Democrats and  percent of Republicans are still undecided heading into Super Tuesday and nearly a quarter of the Democrats and a third of Republicans who had made a choice said they still might change their minds PERIOD

Obama a longtime Chicagoan led among Democrats with  percent PERIOD New York Sen PERIOD Hillary Rodham Clinton who was born in Chicago and raised in suburban Park Ridge has support from  percent PERIOD

Among Republicans Arizona Sen PERIOD McCain found support from  percent of likely GOP voters compared with  percent for former Massachusetts Gov PERIOD Mitt Romney  percent for former Arkansas Gov PERIOD Mike Huckabee and four percent for Texas Rep PERIOD Ron Paul PERIOD

The poll conducted for the Chicago Tribune and WGNTV by Market Shares has a margin of error of plus or minus . percentage points PERIOD The survey of  Republicans and Democrats was conducted Tuesday through Thursday PERIOD

Fortyeight percent of Democrats said Obama has the best chance of beating a Republican in November compared to  who favored Clinton PERIOD On the Republican side  percent said McCain has the best chance of winning in November compared with  percent for Romney and four percent for Huckabee PERIOD

Both Democrats with  percent and Republicans at  percent cited the economy and its impact on employment as their top concern PERIOD Democrats listed health care and the Iraq war as second and third among their concerns while Republicans cited illegal immigration and the war in Iraq PERIOD

Meanwhile a separate TribuneWGNTV survey found that none of the Democratic candidates for Cook County states attorney can claim a solid majority of support among likely voters PERIOD

Fortyfour percent of the  likely voters surveyed said they were undecided in the race to replace States Attorney Dick Devine PERIOD

Cook County Commissioner Larry Suffredin had  percent Chicago Aldermen Tom Allen and Howard Brookins each had  percent as did Cook County prosecutor Anita Alvarez PERIOD

Robert Milan Devines top assistant had  percent and Tommy Brewer a defense lawyer and former FBI agent had  percent PERIOD

The poll had a margin of error of plus or minus  percentage points PERIOD
